mil.emp3.api.interfaces

Interface IMap

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IContainer, IGeoBase, IGeoContainer
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Map

    public interface IMap
extends IContainer
    This interface defines the access to a map instance. Map represents the container that encapsulates the map displayed on the users screen. All overlays and Features are contained within the Map. Map is responsible for starting and displaying a map engine of users choice. An application can display multiple maps on the screen. Applications use either or to build and display a map.

        Sets mirror cache mode to be either EGRESs, INGRESS or BIDIRECTIONAL MirrorCacheModeEnum
        Parameters:
        mode - the operational mode for MirrorCache

      • isEgressEnabled

        boolean isEgressEnabled()
        Returns true if map is enabled to publish data to Mirror Cache.
        Returns:
        true if egress is enabled, false otherwise.

      • isIngressEnabled

        boolean isIngressEnabled()
        Returns true if map is enabled to consume data from the Mirror Cache.
        Returns:
        true if ingress is enabled, false otherwise.

        Returns:

      • getScreenCapture

        void getScreenCapture(IScreenCaptureCallback callback)
        This method request a screen capture from the map. Client software must account for the event of a callback function being invoked prior to the function returning.
        Parameters:
        callback - An implementation of the IScreenCaptureCallback interface.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the callback parameter is null.
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if the map engine does not support screen capture operations.

      • getCamera

        ICamera getCamera()
        This method retrieves the map's current camera.
        Returns:
        ICamera

      • setCamera

        void setCamera(ICamera camera,
               boolean animate,
               java.lang.Object userContext)
        throws EMP_Exception
        This method sets the map's camera therefore changing the viewing area of the map. The map registers for camera change events for the camera and will update the map viewing area on each change event.
        Parameters:
        camera - This parameter must contain the new camera setting to be applied to map's viewing area.
        animate - If set to true then map will animate to the new position
        userContext - user defined object
        Throws:
        EMP_Exception - The exception is raised if a processing error is encountered.

      • setCamera

               boolean animate)

      • setVisibility

        void setVisibility(IContainer target,
                   VisibilityActionEnum actionEnum)
            throws EMP_Exception
        This method performs the visibility action on the target object under all of its parents on this map.
        Parameters:
        target - The object to perform the action on. (See IOverlay, IFeature)
        actionEnum - The action to perform. See VisibilityActionEnum.
        Throws:
        EMP_Exception - If the target is not on the map or the target is not an overlay or feature.

            throws EMP_Exception

        targetList - A list of one or more objects to perform the action on. (See IOverlay, IFeature)
        actionEnum - The action to perform. See VisibilityActionEnum.
        Throws:
        EMP_Exception - If any target is not on the map or not an overlay or feature.

      • setVisibility

        void setVisibility(IContainer target,
                   IContainer parent,
                   VisibilityActionEnum actionEnum)
            throws EMP_Exception
        This method performs the visibility action on the target object under the specified parent on this map.
        Parameters:
        target - The object to perform the action on. (See IOverlay, IFeature)
        parent - The parent object of the target that the action will be applied to,
        actionEnum - The action to perform. See VisibilityActionEnum.
        Throws:
        EMP_Exception - If the target (or parent) are not on the map, or the target (or parent) are not an overlay or feature.

                   java.lang.Object userContext)
            throws EMP_Exception
        This method performs the visibility action on the targets identified on the list under all of their parents on this map.
        Parameters:
        targetIdList - A list of unique identifiers of the objects to perform the action on.
        actionEnum - The action to perform. See VisibilityActionEnum.
        userContext - user defined object
        Throws:
        EMP_Exception - If the target identified by the Id is not on the map or is not an overlay or feature.

      • setVisibility

        void setVisibility(IContainer target,
                   IContainer parent,
                   VisibilityActionEnum actionEnum,
                   java.lang.Object userContext)
            throws EMP_Exception
        This method performs the visibility action on the target object under the specified parent on this map.
        Parameters:
        target - The object to perform the action on. (See IOverlay, IFeature)
        parent - The parent object of the target that the action will be applied to,
        actionEnum - The action to perform. See VisibilityActionEnum.
        userContext - user defined object
        Throws:
        EMP_Exception - If the target (or parent) are not on the map, or the target (or parent) are not an overlay or feature.

        void setVisibility(java.util.UUID targetId,
                   java.util.UUID parentId,
                   VisibilityActionEnum actionEnum,
                   java.lang.Object userContext)
            throws EMP_Exception
        This method performs the visibility action on the target object under the specified parent on this map.

      • getVisibility

        VisibilityStateEnum getVisibility(IContainer target)
        This method retrieves the visibility of the target object on the map.
        Parameters:
        target - The object of which the visibility state is requested. (See IOverlay, IFeature)
        Returns:
        VisibilityStateEnum.VISIBLE - indicates that the object is visible on the map and its child objects visibility depends on their individual visibility states. VisibilityStateEnum.HIDDEN - indicates that the object is not visible on the map and its child objects visibility state depend on their visibility state with other parent objects null - If the target object is not on the map or not an overlay or feature.

      • getVisibility

        VisibilityStateEnum getVisibility(IContainer target,
                                  IContainer parent)
        This method retrieves the visibility of the target object on the map.
        Parameters:
        target - The object of which the visibility state is requested. (See IOverlay, IFeature)
        parent - A parent of the target object of which the visibility state is requested. (See IOverlay, IFeature)
        Returns:
        VisibilityStateEnum.VISIBLE - indicates that the object is visible on the map and its child objects visibility depends on their individual visibility states. VisibilityStateEnum.HIDDEN - indicates that the target object under the specified parent is marked to be not visible on the map. The target objects actual visibility depends on its visibility setting under another parent if it has others. VisibilityStateEnum.VISIBLE_ANCESTOR_HIDDEN - indicates that the target object under the specified parent is marked to be visible on the map, however no ancestral path from the parent to this root map is visible. null - If the target (or parent) object are not on the map or not an overlay or feature.

      • editFeature

        void editFeature(IFeature oFeature)
          throws EMP_Exception
        This method places the specified feature into edit mode and EditorMode changes to EDIT_MODE.
        Parameters:
        oFeature - The specified feature
        Throws:
        EMP_Exception - The exception is raised if a processing error is encountered. I.E. If the feature is currently not on this map, or the map can't edit a feature of that type, or there is a draw or edit in progress or MapMotionLockMode is LOCK/SMART_LOCK.

      • editFeature

        void editFeature(IFeature oFeature,
                 IEditEventListener listener)
          throws EMP_Exception
        This method places the specified feature into edit mode and EditorMode changes to EDIT_MODE.
        Parameters:
        oFeature - The specified feature
        listener - A listener to handler the edit session events. This listener is unregistered when the edit session is completed or canceled.
        Throws:
        EMP_Exception - The exception is raised if a processing error is encountered. I.E. If the feature is currently not on this map, or the map can't edit a feature of that type, or there is a draw or edit in progress or MapMotionLockMode is LOCK/SMART_LOCK.

      • cancelEdit

        void cancelEdit()
         throws EMP_Exception
        This method cancels the edit session on the feature and EditorMode changes to INACTIVE.
        Throws:
        EMP_Exception - The exception is raised if a processing error is encountered. I.E. If the feature is currently not on this map, or the feature is not in edit mode.

      • completeEdit

        void completeEdit()
           throws EMP_Exception
        This method instructs the map to complete the edit session on the feature. All the changes are updated in the core and and EditorMode changes to INACTIVE.
        Throws:
        EMP_Exception - The exception is raised if a processing error is encountered. I.E. If the feature is currently not on this map, or the feature is not in edit mode.

      • drawFeature

        void drawFeature(IFeature oFeature,
                 IDrawEventListener listener)
          throws EMP_Exception
        This method instructs the map to draw the feature specified and EditorMode changes to DRAW_MODE
        Parameters:
        oFeature - The specified feature
        listener - A draw event listener that will received the draw event. This listener will be unregistered when the draw if complete or canceled.
        Throws:
        EMP_Exception - The exception is raised if a processing error is encountered. I.E. If the map is already drawing or editing, or the map can't draw a feature of that type, or MapMotionLockMode is LOCK or SMART_LOCK.

      • drawFreehand

        void drawFreehand(IGeoStrokeStyle initialStyle)
           throws EMP_Exception
        This methods places the map into freehand draw mode if no exception is raised and EditorMode changes to FREEHAND_MODE.
        Parameters:
        initialStyle - This parameters contains the initial style to use for the draw. A value of null causes an EMP_Exception.
        Throws:
        EMP_Exception - if the map does not support free hand drawing, or there is a draw or edit in progress, or MapMotionLockMode is LOCKED or SMART_LOCK.

      • drawFreehand

        void drawFreehand(IGeoStrokeStyle initialStyle,
                  IFreehandEventListener listener)
           throws EMP_Exception
        This methods places the map into freehand draw mode if no exception is raised. The user can use drag gestures to draw lines on the map.

        When entering freehand mode:
        1) - The map is locked in smart lock mode.
        2) - A MAP_ENTERED_FREEHAND_DRAW_MODE event is generated.
        3) - At the first drag gesture a MAP_FREEHAND_LINE_DRAW_START is generated when the first N points (N > 1) have been drawn. As the drawing takes place a line with the specified style is displayed on the map.
        4) - A MAP_FREEHAND_LINE_DRAW_UPDATE event is generated as the user continues the drag gesture.
        5) - When the user ends the drag gesture (lifts the finger or stylist), a MAP_FREEHAND_LINE_DRAW_END event is generated. The event shall contain a list of geospatial coordinates of the line drawn. Once the event return the line is removed from the map, and the list of coordinates is deleted.
        6) - The user may choose to initiate a new drag gesture to generate a new line therefore returning to step # 3.
        7) - When drawComplete is called a MAP_EXIT_FREEHAND_DRAW_MODE is generated, the map is unlocked, 8) - EditorMode changes to INACTIVE. and the map exits freehand draw mode.
        Parameters:
        initialStyle - This parameters contains the initial style to use for the draw. A value of null causes an EMP_Exception.
        listener - This parameters is an event listener to handle the freehand draw events.
        Throws:
        EMP_Exception - if the map does not support freehand drawing, or there is a draw or edit in progress, map is MapMotionLockMode is LOCKED or SMART_LOCK.

      • setFreehandStyle

        void setFreehandStyle(IGeoStrokeStyle style)
               throws EMP_Exception
        This method changes the style used by the freehand operation.
        Parameters:
        style - A value of null has no effect.
        Throws:
        EMP_Exception - if the map is not in freehand drawing.

      • drawFreehandExit

        void drawFreehandExit()
               throws EMP_Exception
        This method causes the map to exit freehand draw mode and EditorMode changes to INACTIVE. If the map is NOT in draw mode the call has no effect.
        Throws:
        EMP_Exception - if the map is not in freehand drawing.

      • setFarDistanceThreshold

        void setFarDistanceThreshold(double dValue)
        This method sets the threshold of the distances beyond which the map displays MilStd single point icons as dots. Current default is 30000.0 meters.
        Parameters:
        dValue - Distance in meters.

      • getFarDistanceThreshold

        double getFarDistanceThreshold()
        This method retrieves the far distance threshold set on the map.
        Returns:
        The distance in meters.

      • setMidDistanceThreshold

        void setMidDistanceThreshold(double dValue)
        This method sets the threshold of the distances beyond which the map displays MilStd single point icons with no modifiers. Icons at distances less than this threshold get displayed as fully qualified icons as per the label setting on the map. Note that this is simply a hint for the system. If EMP core components detect a high level of memory usage this value will be adjusted in the hope of avoiding OutofMemoryError. When memory usage returns to normal an attempt is made to restore the threshold to user set value Current default is 10000.0 meters.
        Parameters:
        dValue - Distance in meters.

      • getMidDistanceThreshold

        double getMidDistanceThreshold()
        This method retrieves the mid distance threshold set by setMidDistanceThreshold. It is not necessarily the value that is actually in effect. Please see notes on setMidDistanceThreshold.
        Returns:
        The distance in meters.

      • setFontSizeModifier

        void setFontSizeModifier(FontSizeModifierEnum value)
                  throws EMP_Exception
        This method is used to apply a scale factor to the font size of all Text and Tactical Graphics features when rendered on the map. The default setting is FontSizeModifierEnum.NORMAL. All features affected get re-rendered with the font size increased or decreased according to this setting.
        Parameters:
        value - FontSizeModifierEnum
        Throws:
        EMP_Exception

      • setBackgroundBrightness

        void setBackgroundBrightness(int setting)
        This method set the brightness of the background maps on the map.
        Parameters:
        setting - Range 0 - 100. 0 Black, 100 white. Values less than 0 are set to 0, and values greater then 100 are set to 100.

      • getBackgroundBrightness

        Returns:
        Return the current value 0 - 100.

      • showMiniMap

        android.view.View showMiniMap()
        This method creates a mini map associated with the map. The android View containing the map is returned to the client. It is the responsibility of the client to add the view to a parent. All touch events are forwarded to the parent of the View. If the mini map has already been created the same view is returned.
        Returns:
        android.view.View

      • hideMiniMap

        void hideMiniMap()
        This method destroys the mini map. The call will remove the view from its parent if it still has a parent. If the mini map has already been destroyed no action is taken.
